title: Teresa and Joe Giudice celebrate 20th wedding anniversary continents apart amid his deportation
text:
Teresa and Joe Giudice commemorated their 20th wedding anniversary continents apart on Wednesday.

The Real Housewives of New Jersey stars, who got married on October 23, 1999, currently remain on different continents, as Joe, 49, was deported to Italy October 11 as his appeal in his deportation case stemming from his 2014 fraud conviction goes through the legal system, with an expected decision coming next month.

The Bravo beauty, 47, did not appear to be abroad as of Wednesday, as her Instagram Stories account indicated business as usual activities such as going out to eat and running on a treadmill.

The latest: Teresa and Joe Giudice, 47 and 49 respectively, commemorated their 20th wedding anniversary continents apart on Wednesday

Joe was ordered by immigration officials to be deported in the wake of his mail, wire and bankruptcy fraud conviction amid 'a crime of moral turpitude' or an 'aggravated felony.'

The Saronno, Italy born businessman - who was brought to the states as a toddler, but never applied to be a U.S. citizen - had been in ICE custody since his sentence ended this past March.

Joe was seen in a clip broadcast on The Daily Dish Monday, saying that he felt more comfortable in Rome - where his attorney said said he intends to work and send money back to his family in the states - than in ICE custody.

'It's better that I'm out here than in there,' he said, adding that his family 'is the most important thing' in his life.

We are family: Joe posed with his brother Pete upon touching down in Italy earlier this month

Simpler times: Joe and Teresa were snapped at an NYC charity event in 2011

He had a message for his wife and four daughters - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10 - in the clip: 'I just want to let you know that I love you and I'm always here for you. You know that.'

It is not immediately clear on if the couple will stay together, as Teresa has past stated that she's not open to moving it Italy or remaining in a long-distance relationship with Joe.

In a recent preview of RHONJ's upcoming season for Bravo Insider, Teresa told castmate Jennifer Aydin that she didn't know if she was still in love with Joe, and told sister-in-law Melissa Gorga that she's been unhappy about the situation for awhile.

'I haven't been happy in so long and I just want to be happy again,' she said.

On her grind: Teresa did not appear to be abroad as of Wednesday, as her Instagram Stories account indicated business as usual activities such as going out to eat and running on a treadmill

Concerned parties: In-laws Melissa and Joe Gorga, snapped in LA earlier this week, are staying optimistic amid the difficult times

United front: Teresa posed with brother Joe at a Halloween event in Florida earlier this month

Joe Gorga, who is Teresa's brother and Melissa's husband, said in a Too Fab article published Wednesday that he was rooting for the two to remain married: 'The kids will keep them together, we hope, we'll see.'

He said that 'it's tough' for Joe and Teresa as they remain 'thousands of miles apart.'

Melissa told the outlet that the family was staying optimistic amid the turbulent times.

'It's all good things, everything is going to start new now,' she said. 'We hope so, fingers crossed.'

Teresa spent most of 2015 in custody in her 11-month sentence in her related conviction, while Joe in March of 2016 started serving his 41-month sentence.

The couple will break their silence in tandem with Andy Cohen Sunday in a TV special titled The Real Housewives of New Jersey Special Event: Joe and Teresa Unlocked, airing Sunday at 8/7c on Bravo.
